document.docAuthor: Cruz Da Silva, Estevam L. & Carico, James E.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thaumasia annulipes
F.O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1903: 154
, plate 14, fig. 2, female holotype from Lower Amazon , Brazil (BMNH 1897.9.20.906-9) (examined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The females of
T. annulipes
( Figs 44, 45 ) resemble those of
T. xingu
sp. nov.
in the shape of the middle field of epigynum ( Fig. 137 ) and in the reduced head of spermathecae ( Fig. 45 ), but can be distinguished by the fewer loops on the copulatory duct 2 ( Fig. 45 ). The males of
T. annulipes
( Figs 52–55 ) resemble those of
T. xingu
sp. nov.
( Fig. 141 ) in the shape of median apophysis and subtegulum (ST), but can be distinguished by the presence of a ventral branch on the RTA ( Fig. 53 , vB) and by the long and slender tip of the ental branch of RTA ( Fig. 53 ).

Condition of holotype .
All legs, carapace and abdomen are loose in the vial.
Distribution. Suriname (Kaiserberg) Peru ( San Martín ) and Brazil (Pará, Amazonas, Acre , Roraima , Mato Grosso do Sul , São Paulo ) ( Fig. 2 ).
